TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in Lohne . He is a dentist and member of ORG ( ORG ) ( “ the ORG ” ) , the self - governing body of the contractual dentists practising in GPE . The ORG is responsible for , inter alia , entering into contracts with public health insurers on behalf of its members , checking costs claimed by its members , distributing reimbursements for contractual work paid by public health insurers , and allocating the effects of austerity measures in the public health sector among its members .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant brought an action against ORG , a public health insurance company , before ORG ( “ the ORG ” ) , seeking assistance in the institution of compensation proceedings for alleged mistreatment of his mother during hospitalisation preceding her death caused by cardiac arrest at DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the action .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant appealed . ORG ( “ ORG of appeal ” ) held oral hearings on DATE and on DATE . It dismissed the appeal on the last - mentioned date , holding that the respondent had sufficiently assisted the applicant by commissioning an expert opinion and declaring the applicant 's further complaints inadmissible because they had not been raised before ORG .
CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE the applicant lodged a constitutional complaint .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG declared the applicant 's constitutional complaint inadmissible without giving further reasons ( CARDINAL BvR CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG determined the applicant 's remuneration as a contractual dentist for DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant made an unsuccessful administrative complaint .
CARDINAL . On DATE he brought an action against the ORG before ORG which suspended the proceedings at the parties ' request on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG modified the impugned decision , stipulating that the applicant was entitled to PERSON ( ORG ) of the DEM CARDINAL,CARDINAL.CARDINAL claimed .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the action after having rescheduled an oral hearing at the applicant 's request . The applicant 's requests for rectifications of the judgment and the transcript of the hearing were to no avail . His attempts to institute criminal proceedings against the presiding judge were unsuccessful .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant 's appeal .
CARDINAL . Furthermore , the applicant unsuccessfully pursued inactivity and constitutional complaint proceedings before ORG and ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG declared the applicant 's constitutional complaint that ORG had taken no action manifestly inadmissible as clearly insufficiently substantiated and imposed a fine of ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL for abuse of process ( CARDINAL BvR CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) .
